<<<<<<< HEAD
The seventh day-Sabbath ceased as ceremonial and yet the morality of the fourth command remaineth, or, Seven reasons tending to prove that the fourth command in the Decalogue is of a different nature from the other nine ... also certain answers to some of the said reasons proved insufficient : whereunto is added a postscript, shewing the judgement of the Jews and antient Christians, touching the Sabbath-day / by Tho. Grantham. Grantham, Thomas, 1634-1692.
[6], 17, [1] p.
Printed for the author, London : 1667.
Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York. Marginal notes.
=======

Grantham. Grantham, Thomas, 1634-1692.
